trans-unit.source: Provides Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) controls for the designer view that represents the workflow canvas.

Implements the <xref:System.Windows.Markup.IComponentConnector> and <xref:System.Windows.Markup.IStyleConnector> interfaces to provide support for named XAML elements and for attaching event handlers to them.
Gets the activity schema.
The activity schema.
Contains the dependency property that represents the <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.View.DesignerView.ActivitySchema"></xref> property.
The command used to add annotation.
The command used to collapse all user interface for the current element.
The command used to collapse the user interface for the current element.
Contains the dependency property that represents the <xref href="System.Activities.Design.View.CommandMenuMode"></xref> property.
Provides types to support the [!INCLUDE[avalon1](~/includes/avalon1-md.md)] input system.
The command used to update the source value in a <xref href="System.Windows.Data.BindingExpression"></xref>.
Gets or sets a collection of services shared between all elements contained in the designer.
You can publish and request services through the context.
The context.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Input.RoutedCommand"></xref> used to copy the current workflow design surface as a screenshot and place it in the clipboard.
Provides types to support the [!INCLUDE[avalon1](~/includes/avalon1-md.md)] input system.
The command used to copy.
The command used to create a new argument.
The command used to create a new variable for the currently selected activity.

The command used to create a new <xref href="System.Activities.Design.WorkflowViewElement"></xref> on the current [!INCLUDE[wfd1](~/includes/wfd1-md.md)] surface when dragging a workflow item from the Toolbox onto the designer surface.
A string constant that contains the GUID for the custom menu items separator.
The command used to cut.
The command used to cycle the various UI elements of the current [!INCLUDE[wfd1](~/includes/wfd1-md.md)] surface.
The command used to delete all annotation.
The command used to delete a specified annotation.
The command used to delete the breakpoint set on the current activity.
The command used to disable the breakpoint set on the current activity.
The command used to edit annotation.
The command used to enable the breakpoint on the current activity.
The command used to expand the list for the current element.
The command used to navigate to the selected child of a composite activity and expand it to fill the full screen of the [!INCLUDE[wfd1](~/includes/wfd1-md.md)] surface.
The View full screen context menu command initiates this action.
The command used to expand the list for the current element in place within the current display.
The command used to fit the current element to the screen.
Saves the state associated with the current designer view.
Gets a value that indicates what view element has the focus.
The view that has the focus.
Contains the dependency property that represents the <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.View.DesignerView.FocusedViewElement"></xref> property.
Retrieves the command menu mode of the specified object.
The object whose command menu mode is retrieved.
The command menu mode for the obj.
The command used to navigate to the parent activity of the selected child activity and expand it to fill the full screen of the [!INCLUDE[wfd1](~/includes/wfd1-md.md)] surface.
The View parent context menu command initiates this action.
The command used to hide all annotations.
Initializes the control.
The InPanMode property.
The command used to set a breakpoint on the current activity.
Gets a value that indicates whether the element is in multiple selection mode.
If you hold down the CTRL or SHIFT key and select more than one element, this is `true`.
If only one element is selected, this is `false`.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.View.DesignerView"></xref> element is in multiple selection mode; otherwise, `false`.
Determines whether the <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.View.DesignerView"></xref> is read only.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.View.DesignerView"></xref> is read only; otherwise, `false`.
Contains the dependency property that represents the <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.View.DesignerView.IsReadOnly"></xref> property.
Places a specified model item at the root (top) of a hierarchy of designers.
The <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.Model.ModelItem)"></xref> that becomes the root designer.
Gets or sets the menu item style.
The menu item style.
Contains the dependency property that represents the <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.View.DesignerView.MenuItemStyle"></xref> property.
Gets or sets the menu separator style.
The menu separator style.
Contains the dependency property that represents the <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.View.DesignerView.MenuSeparatorStyle"></xref> property.
The command used to move the focus.
Raises the ContextMenuOpening event.
The data for the event.

Handles the <xref href="System.Windows.FrameworkElement.Initialized"></xref> event by calling the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.UserControl"></xref> base class implementation, adding an event handler for the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement.GotKeyboardFocus"></xref> routed event, and setting the foreground color for the designer view.
The event data.
Raises the OnKeyDown event.
Data about the event.
Invoked when an unhandled <xref href="System.Windows.DragDrop.PreviewDragOver"></xref> attached event reaches an element in its route that is derived from this class.
The event data.
Called when a PreviewMouseLeftButtonDown event occurs.
The event data.
Raises the PreviewMouseWheel event.
This event is invoked when an unhandled <xref:System.Windows.Input.Mouse.PreviewMouseWheel> attached event reaches an element in its route that is derived from this class.
Override this method to add class handling for this event.
If the CTRL key is pressed when this event is processed, the view is zoomed in or out, based on the movement of the mouse wheel.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Input.MouseWheelEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Refreshes the list of imported namespaces based on whether the specified referenced assembly is added or removed.
If the referenced assembly is added, the namespaces of the types found in the assembly are added to the list of imported namespaces.
If the referenced assembly is removed, the namespaces of the types found in the assembly are removed from the list of imported namespaces.
The referenced assembly that is added or removed.
`true` if the assembly reference is added; `false` if the assembly reference is removed.
The command used to paste.
The command used to redo an operation.
Registers a view element.
The workflow view element.
The command used to reset the zoom.
The command used to restore.
Gets or sets a <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> that is the UI representation of the root of the current model tree.

Call the <xref:System.Activities.Presentation.View.DesignerView.MakeRootDesigner%2A> method to set this property to a <xref:System.Activities.Presentation.WorkflowViewElement> representation of a <xref:System.Activities.Presentation.Model.ModelItem>.
The root element.
Contains the dependency property that represents the <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.View.DesignerView.RootDesigner"></xref> property.
The command used to save the current workflow design surface as an image.
The command used to select all objects in the view.
Sets the command menu mode on a specified dependency object.
The dependency object on which the command menu mode is set.
The command menu mode value to set.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether design view should collapse all visible child elements.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.View.DesignerView"></xref> is read-only; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the element should expand an entire list.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.View.DesignerView"></xref> element should expand an entire list; otherwise, `false`.
The command used to show all annotations.
The command used to show or hide the argument designer.
Clicking the Arguments button on the [!INCLUDE[wfd1](~/includes/wfd1-md.md)] surface initiates this action.
The command used to toggle the imports designer.
The command used to show or hide the MiniMap control on the [!INCLUDE[wfd1](~/includes/wfd1-md.md)] surface.
The command used to toggle the selection.
The command used to show or hide the variable designer.
Clicking the Variables button on the [!INCLUDE[wfd1](~/includes/wfd1-md.md)] surface initiates this action.
The command used to undo the last operation in the buffer.
Unregister a view element.
The workflow view element.
Gets or sets a value that indicates the sort of visibility that the workflow shell bar has.
The value that indicates the sort of visibility that the workflow shell bar has.
Gets or sets a value that indicates the sort of visibility that the workflow shell header has.
The value that indicates the sort of visibility that the workflow shell header has.
Gets the current zoom level of the activity.
The current zoom level of the activity.
The command used to zoom in on the current [!INCLUDE[wfd1](~/includes/wfd1-md.md)] surface.
The command used to zoom out of the current Windows Workflow Designer surface.
Attaches events and names to compiled content.
This interface is intended for use only by the markup compiler.
The connection ID.
The target.
Calls the StyleBamlReader to attach events on EventSetters and Templates in compiled content.
This class is intended for use only by the markup compiler.
The connection ID.
The target.
